material_name: Bastnaesite xenotime and similar REE minerals
sovereignty_rationale: Primary natural source of rare-earth elements; China dominates global supply
notes: Clean REE ore code; no contamination risk

material_name: Intermixtures or interalloys of rare-earth metals scandium and yttrium
sovereignty_rationale: Processed REE alloy form; magnet and catalyst feedstock; China ~90% global refining
High-purity separated REE metals; catalyst and glass polishing feedstock
NdFeB permanent magnet feedstock; wind turbines and EV motors; China dominance
Heavy REE for high-temperature magnets; extreme supply concentration in China

material_name: Europium holmium erbium thulium ytterbium lutetium and yttrium >=95% purity
sovereignty_rationale: Heavy REE metals; phosphor and laser applications; China near-monopoly
Aerospace aluminium-scandium alloys; very limited global supply

material_name: Rare-earth metals scandium and yttrium <95% purity
sovereignty_rationale: Lower-purity REE metals; intermediate processing stage
Cerium oxide for catalytic converters and glass polishing; China dominant
Scandium compounds for SOFC and Al-Sc alloys
Lanthanum oxide for fluid catalytic cracking and battery alloys
NdPr oxide is primary NdFeB magnet precursor; most trade-critical REE compound code
notes: Highest sovereignty relevance in REE group

sovereignty_rationale: Heavy REE compounds for high-temperature magnet dopants; extreme China concentration

material_name: Europium holmium erbium thulium ytterbium lutetium or yttrium compounds
sovereignty_rationale: Mixed heavy REE compounds; phosphor and optical applications

material_name: Compounds of mixtures of rare-earth metals yttrium and scandium
sovereignty_rationale: Mixed/unseparated REE compounds; early-stage processing

material_name: Spodumene petalite lepidolite amblygonite hectorite jadarite and similar lithium minerals
sovereignty_rationale: Primary hard-rock lithium ore; Australia and Chile dominate; battery supply chain entry point
LiOH is primary cathode precursor for NMC and LFP batteries; Chile/China refining dominance
Li2CO3 is primary lithium commodity; battery cathode and electrolyte precursor
Nickel ore for battery-grade nickel sulphate; Indonesia/Philippines dominance
notes: Single CN8 code for all nickel ores

sovereignty_rationale: Intermediate nickel smelter product; feedstock for Class 1 nickel

material_name: Nickel oxide sinters and other intermediate products of nickel metallurgy
sovereignty_rationale: Intermediate nickel products; HPAL and pyrometallurgical routes
Class 1 nickel metal; battery and stainless steel feedstock
Cobalt ore; DRC supplies ~70% of global mine production
notes: Single CN8 code for all cobalt ores

material_name: Cobalt mattes and other intermediate products; unwrought cobalt; cobalt powders
sovereignty_rationale: Cobalt metal and intermediates; battery cathode and superalloy feedstock; DRC/China refining chain
CoO/Co(OH)2 for battery cathode precursors; China refining dominance
notes: Single CN8 code — no subheading split

sovereignty_rationale: Manganese ore for steel and battery-grade MnSO4; South Africa/Gabon/Australia
EMD/CMD for alkaline and lithium-ion battery cathodes
High-grade manganese oxide; battery and chemical applications
Lower-grade manganese oxides; steel and chemical use

material_name: Natural graphite in powder or in flakes
sovereignty_rationale: Natural flake graphite for battery anodes; China ~65% global supply
Lump and amorphous natural graphite; foundry and refractory use
Tungsten ore; China ~80% of global mine production; armour-piercing ammunition and cutting tools
Tungsten carbide feedstock; hardmetal tooling and munitions

material_name: Unwrought tungsten including bars and rods obtained simply by sintering
sovereignty_rationale: Primary tungsten metal form; defense and industrial tooling
WC for cemented carbide cutting tools and armour-piercing cores
Intermediate tungsten chemical; precursor to tungsten metal and WC
Ilmenite and rutile for titanium sponge; aerospace and defense structural metal
Titanium sponge and powder for aerospace airframes and jet engines
Molybdenum concentrate for steel alloys and superalloys; Chile/China/US
Raw molybdenum ore; byproduct of copper mining
Mo powder for sintered products and superalloy feedstock

material_name: Unwrought molybdenum including bars and rods obtained simply by sintering
sovereignty_rationale: Primary molybdenum metal form
MoO3 technical oxide; steel alloy and catalyst feedstock

material_name: Niobium tantalum or vanadium ores and concentrates
sovereignty_rationale: Niobium ore (pyrochlore); Brazil ~90% global supply; HSLA steel and superalloys
notes: Bundles Nb/Ta/V ores — cannot separate at CN8 level

sovereignty_rationale: Niobium metal for superconducting magnets and HSLA steel ferroniobium
Vanadium metal for HSLA steel and vanadium redox flow batteries
V2O5 for steel alloys and vanadium redox batteries; China/Russia/South Africa

material_name: Carbides of aluminium chromium molybdenum vanadium tantalum and titanium
sovereignty_rationale: Mixed strategic carbides for cemented carbide and cermet tooling
notes: Bundles multiple carbide types — cannot separate

sovereignty_rationale: Rhenium for single-crystal jet engine superalloy blades; extreme scarcity

material_name: Unwrought hafnium and hafnium waste scrap and powders
sovereignty_rationale: Hafnium for nuclear reactor control rods and superalloys; byproduct of zirconium
Zircon sand for ceramics and nuclear-grade zirconium; Australia/South Africa
Electronic-grade polysilicon for semiconductor wafers; dual-use export controlled
notes: Clean high-purity code; solar PV polysilicon also here

sovereignty_rationale: Metallurgical-grade silicon; ferrosilicon feedstock and solar-grade Si
Germanium for IR optics and fibre-optic cables; China ~60% global supply; export-controlled by China
GeO2 precursor for germanium metal and PET catalyst; includes ZrO2
notes: Bundles germanium oxide with zirconium dioxide — cannot separate

sovereignty_rationale: Gallium for GaAs and GaN semiconductors; China ~95% global supply; export-controlled by China since 2023
Indium for ITO displays and InP semiconductors; China dominant; byproduct of zinc smelting
Tellurium for CdTe thin-film solar and thermoelectric devices; China dominant
Helium for semiconductor fab cooling and MRI; US/Qatar/Algeria supply; non-substitutable in chip manufacturing
notes: Gas not solid material — but critical semiconductor input

sovereignty_rationale: Phosphate rock unground; Morocco/Western Sahara ~70% global reserves; fertilizer feedstock
Ground phosphate rock; processed form for direct application or chemical processing
Low-grade muriate of potash (MOP); fertilizer use; Russia/Belarus/Canada dominate
Standard-grade MOP; dominant potash fertilizer product
High-grade MOP; premium potash fertilizer
SOP fertilizer for chloride-sensitive crops; more limited supply than MOP

material_name: Carnallite sylvite and other crude natural potassium salts and mixtures
sovereignty_rationale: Crude natural potash salts; raw mineral form before processing
